questions.question: What is the difference between 'margin' and 'padding' in CSS?

answers.text: Margin is the space outside an element that creates distance between the element and other elements. Padding is the space inside an element that creates distance between the element's border and its content.
answers.feedback: Excellent answer that clearly distinguishes between margin and padding with proper definitions.

answers.text: Margin is outside the element and padding is inside the element.
answers.feedback: Good basic understanding, but your answer could include more detail about their exact functions.

answers.text: They both add space to elements but in different ways.
answers.feedback: This answer is vague. You should specify exactly how margin and padding differ in their positioning and effects.

answers.text: Flexbox is a CSS layout model that allows elements to be aligned and distributed within a container. It provides a more efficient way to layout, align, and distribute space among items, even when their size is unknown or dynamic. It works in one dimension at a time (either as a row or as a column).
answers.feedback: Great comprehensive answer covering what flexbox is, its purpose, and how it functions.

answers.text: Flexbox is a CSS layout method for arranging items in rows or columns. Items will expand or shrink based on available space.
answers.feedback: Good answer covering the basics of flexbox, but could mention more about alignment capabilities.

answers.text: It's a way to position elements on a webpage.
answers.feedback: This answer is too general and doesn't specifically address the unique properties of flexbox.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in an HTML image tag?

answers.text: The 'alt' attribute provides alternative text for an image if it cannot be displayed. It's essential for accessibility as screen readers use this text to describe images to visually impaired users. It also helps with SEO and displays when images fail to load.
answers.feedback: Excellent answer covering all aspects of the alt attribute, including accessibility, SEO, and fallback functionality.

answers.text: It shows text when the image doesn't load and helps screen readers describe the image.
answers.feedback: Good answer covering the basic purposes, but could mention more about SEO benefits.

answers.text: It's for when images don't load properly.
answers.feedback: This answer only covers one aspect of the alt attribute. You should mention accessibility benefits as well.

questions.question: What does the 'event.preventDefault()' method do in JavaScript?

answers.text: event.preventDefault() stops the default action of an HTML element from happening. For example, it can prevent a form from submitting, a link from following its href, or a checkbox from being checked/unchecked. This allows developers to implement custom behaviors without the browser's default actions interfering.
answers.feedback: Excellent answer that clearly explains the method's purpose with good examples.

answers.text: It prevents the default behavior of elements like form submission or link clicks.
answers.feedback: Good basic explanation but could include more detail about when and why you would use this method.
This answer is vague and imprecise. preventDefault() doesn't stop events - it prevents default actions associated with events.

questions.question: How do you make a website responsive?

answers.text: To make a website responsive, use a combination of: 1) Media queries to apply different styles at different viewport sizes, 2) Flexible grid layouts (like flexbox or grid), 3) Relative units (%, em, rem, vh, vw) instead of fixed pixels, 4) Responsive images using max-width:100% or srcset attribute, and 5) Meta viewport tag to control the viewport settings.
answers.feedback: Excellent comprehensive answer covering multiple techniques for responsive design.

answers.text: Use media queries and flexible layouts to make content adjust to different screen sizes.
answers.feedback: Good basic understanding, but your answer would be stronger if you mentioned specific techniques like relative units and responsive images.

answers.text: Make it look good on mobile phones too.
answers.feedback: This answer demonstrates only a surface-level understanding of responsive design. You should mention specific techniques used to achieve responsiveness.
